title: Getting Started
explanation: TypeScript is JavaScript with syntax for types. It helps catch errors early and makes code more maintainable.

codeBlocks.title: Installation & Setup
codeBlocks.code:
# Install TypeScript globally
npm install -g typescript

# Check version
tsc --version

# Initialize a new project with tsconfig.json
tsc --init

# Compile TypeScript to JavaScript
tsc index.ts

# Watch mode (auto-compile on save)
tsc --watch

# Compile entire project (uses tsconfig.json)
tsc

codeBlocks.title: Your First TypeScript File
Project Setup with npm
codeBlocks.code:
# Create project folder
mkdir my-ts-project && cd my-ts-project

# Initialize npm project
npm init -y

# Install TypeScript as dev dependency
npm install typescript --save-dev

# Create tsconfig.json
npx tsc --init

# Add scripts to package.json:
# "build": "tsc"
# "start": "node dist/index.js"

tip: Always use a tsconfig.json for projects. It centralizes compiler options and makes your project more maintainable. Use 'npx tsc' if TypeScript is installed locally.
